title: India v New Zealand: Women’s Cricket World Cup – live
summary: In the over-by-over report, hosts India, facing three successive defeats, have a chance to secure the final semi-final spot with a win. Updates will be provided by the writers as the match unfolds. Stay tuned for live insights.

title: Australia v India: second men’s one-day international – live
summary: Australia is chasing a target of 265 runs to win the ODI match at Adelaide Oval. A victory would secure the series for the team. Live updates and commentary are available from the writers.

title: King Charles becomes first British monarch to pray with pope in 500 years – Europe live
summary: King Charles and Pope Francis participated in a joint worship service at the Sistine Chapel during the King's visit to the Vatican with Queen Camilla. This event marked a significant moment of collaboration between the British monarchy and the Catholic Church. The occasion emphasized their shared commitment to promoting religious and humanitarian values.

title: Trump plans to send federal agents to San Francisco ‘right out of dictator’s handbook’, says Newsom – US politics live
summary: California Governor condemns the recent immigration enforcement operation, criticizing its impact on local communities. The governor's stance is likely to escalate tensions between state officials and the federal administration. Local leaders are expected to unite in opposition, seeking to protect their constituents from the operation's consequences.

title: UK manufacturers hit by largest drop in orders since 2020; FTSE 100 hits fresh record high – business live
summary: British manufacturers face their lowest order prospects since the Covid-19 pandemic, according to a CBI report. This decline comes as demand has weakened over the past three months. The situation raises concerns about the future of manufacturing in the UK.
